newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares slide on back of Mosenergo.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares slide on back of Mosenergo.

text.p: Sales of Russian regional utility Mosenergo sent the thin shares market into a slow slide on Tuesday, said traders.
Leading shares, they said, could ease through the week.
The Russian Trading System index of 22 shares dropped 1.5 percent to 291.32 from 295.61 on Monday. Total market turnover was a low $28.3 million.
International long-distance telecom Rostelekom fell to $3.46 from $3.55 and national power utility UES slipped to $0.2090 from $0.2162.
Aton trader Alexander Bobolev said investors were not happy that Mosenergo still planned to issue shares, which it announced on Thursday and at its annual meeting on Monday.
"But I would say that today's fall was on profit-taking," he said.
Mosenergo last week said it would put off proposing a share authorisation originally scheduled for the annual meeting but said the plan was still a company priority.
Trinfiko said trader Grigory Pinsky said aggressive Western selling of Mosenergo, the top-traded share by dollar volume on Tuesday, sent the market into a chain reaction.
Bobolev said the market could ease through the week, but said individual deals had an exaggerated effect in the thin market, generally considered to be under $40 million daily turnover in Russia.
